characters.alibi: Was at home all night, working on his next article. His upstairs neighbor, Sarah, confirms hearing him typing until late.
characters.description: A seasoned investigative journalist known for his bold exposés.
characters.name: Miles Corbin

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at a gallery opening downtown.
characters.description: A successful art dealer with a sophisticated air.
characters.name: Vivienne Laroux

characters.alibi: He does not have one, and refuses to say other than he was out.
characters.description: An avid gambler known to have large debts.
characters.name: Frank Decker

characters.alibi: Confirmed at a business dinner with clients.
characters.description: A renowned technology entrepreneur with a reputation for innovation.
characters.name: Evelyn Reed

characters.alibi: She was home sick. Her husband was out with work colleagues.
characters.description: The victim's grieving widow, a former librarian.
characters.name: Olivia Clark

characters.description: A retired accountant and close friend of the victim.
characters.name: Arthur Jenkins

characters.alibi: Confirmed by multiple colleagues as being at an out-of-state conference.
characters.description: The victim, a respected economics professor.
characters.name: Victor Clark

characters.alibi: He was working at the bar all night and can be vouched for; a few customers state he seemed distracted.
characters.description: A young barman at 'The Rusty Mug'.
characters.name: Tony Moretti
characters.personality: Friendly, observant, and eager to please.

characters.description: A dance instructor who teaches evening dance classes.
characters.name: Catherine Debois

clues.description: A threatening letter found in Victor's study, warning him to drop a certain 'investigation'.
clues.name: Threatening Letter

clues.description: An interview with Miles Corbin reveals his recent series of articles targeted the exact people Victor Clark was investigating, implying more sinister behaviour.
clues.name: Interview with Miles Corbin

clues.description: A receipt from Vivienne Laroux's gallery opening, though it is stamped with the gallery name it can be faked and does not prove her presence.
clues.name: Gallery Opening Alibi

clues.description: Frank Decker owes a significant amount of money to various underground bookies.
clues.name: Gambling Debts

clues.description: Evelyn Reed has a signed receipt proving a business dinner with clients. The receipts are all in order.
clues.name: Business Dinner Receipt

clues.description: Olivia Clark has a prescription for sleeping pills, indicating she may have been asleep and unaware of events when Victor was killed.
clues.name: Olivia's Prescription

clues.description: Arthur Jenkins shows his visit logs to have been a regular occurance, every Tuesday, at 2PM.
clues.name: Arthur's Visit Log

clues.description: Tony Moretti claims to have served drinks to Frank Decker on the night of the murder. Claims he was jittery and acting suspicious.
clues.name: Witness Account - Tony

clues.description: The victim was found dead at home in the study. It was made to look like a heart attack.
clues.name: Crime Scene Description

clues.description: A family photo shows Victor and Olivia Clark looking happy, but it's an old photo and there are signs the relationship had become strained. Shown by neighbour.
clues.name: Family Photo

clues.description: Financial records discovered show Victor Clark was investigating some suspicious activity with Miles Corbin’s previous series of articles.
clues.name: Financial Records

clues.description: The witness, Tony, offers very little detail other than Frank being a rather unremarkable middled aged man.
clues.name: Description from witness

clues.description: The expensive watch found in the house shows reciepts belonging to Evelyn Reed, and was a gift for Victor Clark.
clues.name: Expensive watch receipt

clues.description: Interview with Evelyn reveals she was working for Victor Clark with his Financial Investigation, and they had become close.
clues.name: Interview Evelyn

clues.description: Arthur has a strong alibi, and the police confirm he visits every Tuesday at 2PM.
clues.name: Interview Arthur

clues.description: Receipt of Vivienne buying sleeping pills from a local pharmacy.
clues.name: Viviennes receipt

clues.description: Tony claims he saw Frank Decker outside the clark residence on the night of the murder.
clues.name: late night typing

clues.description: Catherine states that Frank had been coming for beginner dance lessons, but dropped out 2 weeks ago and never offered a reason why.
clues.name: Interview Catherine

clues.description: The dance roster shows that Frank has been attending dance classes, and there has been no reason for dismissal.
clues.name: Dance Class roster

clues.description: The dance shoes are brand new and show no signs of use, but do have a speck of mud on them.
clues.name: Dance Shoes

clues.description: Interview with Frank Decker shows that he met Vivienne on a dating app 2 weeks ago, and they have been getting private lessons together.
clues.name: Interview Frank

clues.description: Vivienne Laroux's testimony reveals that she had been feeling pressured by Victor Clark regarding the sale of a potentially fraudulent painting.
clues.name: Interview with Vivienne Laroux

clues.description: Olivia Clark expresses deep shock and disbelief regarding her husband's death, and mentions he had been stressed lately.
clues.name: Interview with Olivia Clark

clues.description: Tony Moretti mentions Frank Decker seemed more interested in his phone than his drink, constantly checking it and looking anxious.
clues.name: Interview with Tony Moretti

locations.description: A cozy house with a study filled with books and research papers.
locations.name: Clark Residence

locations.description: A modern art gallery showcasing various contemporary pieces.
locations.name: Art Gallery

locations.description: A dimly lit, neighborhood bar with a loyal clientele.
locations.name: The Rusty Mug

locations.description: A sleek, modern office space reflecting a high-tech company.
locations.name: Evelyn's Office

locations.description: A modest, well-kept home filled with antique furniture.
locations.name: Arthur's House

locations.description: A cramped apartment filled with stacks of books and papers.
locations.name: Miles' Apartment

locations.description: A lively space for dance and musical practice.
locations.name: Dance Studio

mystery.description: A seemingly natural death of a respected economics professor turns out to be a well-concealed murder.
mystery.title: The Clark Case

solution.method: Poisoning with sleeping pills. Vivienne added a lethal dose of sleeping pills mixed with cyanide, purchased using her name. Giving him a heart attack.
solution.motive: Victor Clark was investigating Miles Corbin’s past series of articles, which implicated Vivienne in an art fraud scheme. To silence him, Vivienne used her recent interest in Frank Decker to meet Victor late one night, using beginners dancing classes to trick him into being alone at the clinic residence. She then injected him with drugs obtained from a back alley dealer, who’s address she found on one of Frank’s gambling debts.
